queue.tweet: Markets open higher as investors await the Fed decision. Dow ~45,800; S&P ~6,600; Nasdaq ~22,240, led by AI/big tech. Drivers: policy path, inflation data, earnings. Week ahead: Fed guidance, CPI/PPI, and key tech results could move markets.
queue.summary:
Markets are moving into a Fed-week with major indices near records. Dow around 45,800; S&P near 6,600; Nasdaq around 22,240, led by AI and megacaps. 

Key drivers are policy signals, inflation data, and earnings tone. 

Week ahead could see volatility around the Fed decision and data releases.

queue.tweet: SPY idea: Sep 19, 2025 bull call spread. Buy 660 strike call, sell 680 strike call. Net debit small. Pros: defined risk and upside if SPY climbs above 660 by expiry, especially with Fed action and AI earnings in focus.
queue.summary:
Strategy: a defined-risk bull call spread on SPY with Sep 19, 2025 expiry. Buy SPY 660 call, sell SPY 680 call to cap cost.

Rationale: upside if SPY moves through 660 by expiration, aided by a potential Fed tilt and AI/computer-technology earnings. Risks: time decay and IV changes.
